title: Shock Le Pen verdict rocks French far right
snippets: The far-right figurehead has been barred from running for public office for five years, throwing her plans into disarray.
summary: A far-right political figure has been banned from seeking any public office for the next five years, disrupting her political ambitions.

title: BBC Verify: What satellite images reveal about Myanmar's quake
snippets: Myanmar's military government says at least 2,000 people were killed in last week's 7.7 magnitude quake.
summary: Myanmar's military government reported that a 7.7 magnitude earthquake last week resulted in at least 2,000 fatalities.

title: US deports more alleged gang members to El Salvador
snippets: Officials said 17 alleged criminals were deported despite a court order.
summary: Seventeen individuals, identified as alleged criminals, were deported despite the existence of a court order that should have prevented their removal.

title: Roof ripped off home as severe storms and tornadoes hit central US
snippets: Several states have been hit with heavy rain, hail and damaging winds, with storms expected to continue in some areas through Thursday.
summary: Several states are experiencing severe weather conditions, including heavy rain, hail, and damaging winds. The storms are forecasted to persist in some regions until Thursday.

title: Russia still 'working with US' after Trump says he is 'angry' with Putin
snippets: In its first response to Trump's criticism of Putin, the Kremlin tried to play down the tensions between the two leaders.
summary: The Kremlin has responded to former President Trump's criticism of President Putin by attempting to minimize the perceived discord between the two leaders.

title: Breaking down the 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game
snippets: Everything you need to know about the 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game on Tuesday (6:30 p.m. ET, ESPN2).
summary: The 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game is scheduled for Tuesday at 6:30 p.m. ET and will be broadcast on ESPN2.

title: What will Titans, Browns do with top 2 draft picks? From QBs to generational players, breaking down 5 biggest questions
snippets: Would Tennessee consider trading down? Does Cleveland actually want to trade *up*? Is anyone besides a QB in play at the top of the draft? Here's what Monday's interview sessions at the spring owners meetings tell us.
summary: During Monday's interview sessions at the spring owners meetings, discussions emerged about potential draft strategies. Questions were raised about whether Tennessee might trade down and if Cleveland is looking to trade up. Additionally, there was speculation on whether players other than quarterbacks are being considered for top draft picks.

title: Braves' Profar gets 80-game ban for PED violation
snippets: Atlanta Braves outfielder Jurickson Profar was suspended for 80 games by Major League Baseball on Monday after a positive test for the performance-enhancing drug chorionic gonadotropin.
summary: Atlanta Braves outfielder Jurickson Profar has been suspended for 80 games by Major League Baseball due to a positive test for the performance-enhancing drug chorionic gonadotropin.

title: Pels shut down Zion, McCollum for rest of season
snippets: The New Orleans Pelicans are shutting down Zion Williamson (back) and CJ McCollum (foot) for the rest of the season.
The New Orleans Pelicans announced on Monday that Zion Williamson and CJ McCollum will not play again this season.
summary: The New Orleans Pelicans have announced that Zion Williamson, due to a back injury, and CJ McCollum, due to a foot injury, will not play for the remainder of the season.

title: Browns' Haslam: 'Big swing-and-miss' on Watson
snippets: Browns co-owner Jimmy Haslam said the team "took a big swing-and-miss" in acquiring QB Deshaun Watson and signing him to a $230 million deal that was fully guaranteed.
summary: Browns co-owner Jimmy Haslam admitted the team made a significant error in acquiring QB Deshaun Watson and signing him to a fully guaranteed $230 million deal, describing the move as a "big swing-and-miss."

title: US stocks post worst quarter since 2022 as tariff worries swirl
snippets: S&P 500 sinks almost 5% in first three months of 2025 on rising concerns over economy
summary: The S&P 500 dropped nearly 5% in the first quarter of 2025, driven by increasing worries about the economy.

title: Trump has promised tariff ‘liberation day’. Americans aren’t so sure
snippets: Even the president’s supporters are sceptical of new levies to be imposed on trading partners on April 2
summary: The president plans to impose new levies on trading partners starting April 2, a move that has drawn skepticism from even his supporters.

title: Is UBS’s ‘deal of the century’ starting to sour?
snippets: The bank’s integration of Credit Suisse is going well. It’s everything else that’s the problem
summary: The bank reports that the process of integrating Credit Suisse is progressing smoothly. However, it is facing challenges in other areas of its operations.

title: Lessons from Russia, Turkey and India for Trump’s America
snippets: Fighting for democracy can be a lonely and dangerous business
summary: Advocating for democracy often involves risks and can lead to isolation for those involved in the struggle.

title: America cannot afford to break global investor trust
snippets: Even the most powerful nation in the world needs foreign investment
summary: The United States, recognized as a powerful nation globally, still requires investments from foreign countries to support its economy.

title: Delicate balancing act determines how many genome gateways form in cells
snippets: As warehouses go, nuclei are more like libraries than bank vaults. Too many cellular components need access to the genome to lock it down like Fort Knox. Instead, large groupings of more than 1,000 individual protein molecules called nuclear pore complexes (NPCs) pepper the dividing membrane, serving as gateways for materials and messages entering and exiting the nucleus. While the basic need for this shuttle service is constant, scientists have shown that cells dynamically adjust their amounts of NPCs like a retail store opening more or fewer checkout lines throughout the day. Scientists now reveal the results of screening the entire human genome to find factors influencing how many NPCs are assembled.
summary: Scientists have discovered that cells regulate the number of nuclear pore complexes (NPCs), which act as gateways for materials and messages to enter and exit the nucleus, much like checkout lines in a retail store. This adjustment is based on the cell's needs, challenging the previous notion of the nucleus as a static structure. The research involved screening the entire human genome to identify factors that influence the assembly of NPCs, highlighting the dynamic nature of cellular components.

title: Change in oxygen standards for trauma patients?
snippets: A recent study finds most critically injured patients can recover with less supplemental oxygen than has previously been suggested.
summary: A recent study has shown that critically injured patients may recover effectively with lower levels of supplemental oxygen than previously recommended.

title: New study links lower proportions of certain sleep stages to brain changes associated with Alzheimer's disease
snippets: New research reveals that lower proportions of specific sleep stages are associated with reduced brain volume in regions vulnerable to the development of Alzheimer's disease over time.
summary: Recent research has found a link between decreased amounts of certain sleep stages and a reduction in brain volume in areas susceptible to Alzheimer's disease progression.

title: Machine learning model to predict virus reservoirs
snippets: A new artificial intelligence tool could aid in limiting or even prevent pandemics by identifying animal species that may harbor and spread viruses capable of infecting humans. The machine learning model analyzes host characteristics and virus genetics to identify potential animal reservoirs and geographic areas where new outbreaks are more likely to occur.
summary: A new artificial intelligence tool has been developed to help prevent pandemics. It works by identifying animal species that could harbor and spread viruses to humans. The tool uses machine learning to analyze characteristics of hosts and virus genetics, aiming to pinpoint potential animal reservoirs and the geographic areas where new outbreaks could emerge.

title: Common anticancer drugs may offer new hope to PTEN Hamartoma Tumour Syndrome patients
snippets: A new study on the genetic causes of the PTEN Hamartoma Tumour Syndrome (PHTS) has found that inhibitors of the PI3ka pathway, commonly used as anticancer drugs, are also effective against this disease, reducing the extent of vascular malformations and lesion-associated pain in animal models. The research suggests the repurposing of these drugs may offer a new hope for PHTS patients, especially at younger ages.
summary: A study has discovered that drugs inhibiting the PI3ka pathway, typically used in cancer treatment, can also treat PTEN Hamartoma Tumour Syndrome (PHTS) by lessening vascular malformations and pain in animal models. This finding suggests these drugs could be repurposed to help PHTS patients, potentially benefiting younger individuals.
